lines.line: Hello!
What?
I said hello!
Hello!
Who are you?
Why, I'm Dondakan, of course!
Why are you firing a cannon at a wall?
It's not a wall! It's a rock!
What's the difference?
It's a very special rock!
I still don't quite follow...
Oh, for Guthix' sake, it's perfectly simple! See, that rock over there, it's impenetrable!
Have you tried taking a pickaxe to it?
Of course I have, I'm holding this rune pickaxe, aren't I? We've been trying to mine through it for years!
We? I don't see anyone else.
Well, I'm the only one left... all the others gave up. Said it wasn't worth their while anymore.
Isn't there?
At first we thought there might be a huge treasure behind the rock, you see.
Until we had a look further down the stream, around the rock... no, there's no treasure there, just a dead end.
Okay... so why were you trying to get through the rock again?
Because obviously there are vast deposits of minerals inside the rock! And if not, I want to harness the extreme hardness of the rock itself!
The only problem is that I have run out of ideas on how to do it.
Perhaps a young adventurer like you is willing to help out an old dwarf like me? Want to find out what's inside the rock?
Sure, sounds interesting!
Welcome aboard then!
No thanks, I do enough mining on my own.
Cozy? No, not really, it's damp and cold!
Bit noisy here, isn't it?
Then stop shouting!
No! I said it's noisy!
Goodbye!
Any idea on what's inside the rock?
No, but that's where you come in!
I want you to find out some more information on the rock.
How so?
I don't know! Wish I knew!
But we have to get some better understanding of what this thing actually is. Maybe then we can find a way to break it open.
Now where would I do that?
And what are you going to do while I go running across half of Gielinor, I'll wager?
I'll guard my cannon and fire more cannonballs at it, of course! Wish I had your job, mine's a tough one!
Want to trade places?
My legs are too old and worn to do much running around anymore, I'm afraid.
Well, off you go now! Start running, start talking!
But I still don't know where!
Oh, why so difficult?
Look, try the city, further down the stream here. There's bound to be someone there who knows something. If you still can't find anyone, go to the librarian, he knows a lot.
What did you need me to do?
I'll be back later.
What do you know about impenetrable rocks?
Welcome to the Keldagrim library, human traveller!
You're confusing me, what rock exactly are you talking about?
The big one in the mines south of the city. Dondakan's big rock.
I see, I see.
But I don't know much about that rock, I'm afraid. It's baffled us for many generations.
There is a dwarf in the mechanics shop, though, who I believe has some connections with a certain scholar.
Go south to the palace, the shop is called Wemund's Wrench Warehouse. He should be working there somewhere.
Thanks!
Do you know anything about this rock in the mines?
Now what rock would that be, exactly?
The big rock in the mines to the south, with an old dwarf standing beside it..?
Ah, Don's rock, right?
Er, yes, I think so. Do you know what it's made of?
No, no one knows. No one here, anyway. The only one I can think of is Rolad, a renowned scholar.
He left to explore the world. Learning by experience, or so he said. Me, I prefer a cold stout at home, but it takes all sorts.
So where can I find this Rolad?
I think he's currently with the Black Guard at Ice Mountain.
Great, thanks a lot!
Excuse me... would you happen to be Rolad the scholar?
Why, yes, I think so... who's asking?
It's this rock that Dondakan is trying to break open. You know Dondakan, right?
You're awfully tall for a dwarf, you know. And a rock you say? I suppose I know a fair bit about rocks, yes.
Oh, old Dondakan, sure I know him. And I know his rock too. It's that unbreakable one, isn't it?
Yes, that's the one. What can you tell me about it?
Well, as a matter of fact, I picked up an interesting book on one of my travels, from a quite out of the way dwarven outpost.
I'm not entirely sure, but it seems to describe this very rock, and how it came to be placed in that cavern.
I tore out the most interesting pages for more detailed perusal. Let me get them for you.
Oh dear...
What's wrong?
I seem to have misplaced the pages... a pity, I had wanted to study them some more. Oh well...
What? No! I need that book!
Oh, well, if it's that important to you, perhaps you can go and look for the pages? There should be three of them.
Where should I start looking?
I probably lost them in the mines below. I don't have them up here in any case.
What, in the mining guild?
No no, I never go there, I'm not a member you know. But I sometimes go down to the regular mines to study the conditions of the working dwarf.
Okay, thanks, I'll go and look for the pages then.
Rolad has a book that might help us!
Well, that's the problem... the most important pages are missing.
How are you getting on with finding those missing pages?
I haven't found a single one yet, I have no idea where I should be looking.
Well, I found the first page, but I still have two to go.
I found two of the pages! But I haven't found the last one yet.
Look, I found all of your missing pages!
Why, yes, have you read it yet?
Yes, the missing pages of that book we were talking about earlier?
Well, here, I happened to have a copy of it. Try not to lose it this time!
Of course, I'd be happy to!
I suppose I just forgot that I had one.
Of course... when I've finished with it I'll give it back to you, sure...
Oh yes, have you read it yet?
Why, naturally, that's no problem for someone with such a keen interest in expanding knowledge!
That was quite an interesting book you gave me.
Yes, but I'd like to hang on to it a little longer, if I may.
I have that golden cannonball you asked me to make.
That... that... that's an amazing looking cannonball!
Are you sure you want me to fire it at the rock?
Yes, I'm sure this will crack open the rock.
It breaks my heart to ruin such a fine piece of crafting.
Did... did... did you see that?
The cannonball went right through it!
I don't believe it! All this time, I've been spending all my gold.
But... the rock didn't actually break, did it?
No, it seemed more like it... gave way for a second.
So how does this help us?
Why, I'll just shoot you through it so you can have a look.
Shoot me... through it? Errr... what exactly do you mean?
Very simple. I'll have to make a few modifications to my cannon.
Then I'll fire you at the rock so you can do reconnaissance.
Might want to pick up that cannonball again while you're at it!
But... what if I bump into that demon, the one from the book?
Don't be silly now. It's just a rock... just a rock with gold.
So you want to... fire me into the rock?
Yes, just to see what's inside... to see if all that gold.
Are you sure that it's safe?
No, but then we'll never know until we've tried it, right?
Find someone else for your bizarre experiment!
But we're so close to all that gold!
I can't argue with that, shoot me in!
Well, it's not so simple... like I said, I need to make.
Okay, I'll just wait right here until you've made them.
I don't really know how, actually.
Okay, so you want me to look for the schematics for you?
That's it, yes! Here, I have one part of the schematics.
You'll have to find the rest on your own.
Oh, and you'll also need a golden helmet of course.
Won't a gold plated helmet do?
No, it has to be a helmet made out of solid gold.
Unless you want to die when I shoot you at the rock?
No no, I'll get you a helmet made out of solid gold.
Although that will be a horrendously heavy thing to wear.
Yes yes, well, get going now, why don't you?
That's what I thought you'd say.
What did you want me to find again?
Schematics to modify my cannon, and a golden helmet.
I lost that schematic you gave me, actually.
Oh, be more careful! Here, have a copy.
Sounds simple enough. Any idea on where I can find those?
Not a clue! I don't even know how many parts there are.
It's probably best to ask any dwarven engineers.
Didn't you talk to someone in Keldagrim already?
Again...
No complaining now, run along!
I'm looking for schematics to modify the dwarven multicannon.
Haha, yesh, I have jusht the shing!
I've been working on thish deshign for quite a while.
Never got to test it, love to shee it shoot a real human!
Well, can you give them to me? I'd be willing to try.
Oooh, shure, shure... I've only got one part left.
Who did you give them to?
How should I know? I'm only a shimple dwarf.
Okay, okay, can I have that one schematic then?
Of courshe!
Just give me a drink and I'll gladly help you.
No, I've had enough of buying drinks for people!
It's always like this... Sure, I'll help you, just get me.
And more often than not they actually want a special drink.
And what is wrong with all you people anyway?
Sometimes it seems as if half the population are alcoholics!
So, no, I won't do it anymore, you can get your own drink.
Pffft, I only wanted a dwarven shtout from that table.
Here, have the shtupid schematic, I've gone right off.
Oh, alright, what do you want to drink?
Oooh, jusht a glash of dwarven shtout over there...
Here, I've got your dwarven stout.
That'sh wonderful! You're a good human, you are.
Here, have thish schematic and have fun with it!
Thanks for that schematic.
Sho have you been shot out of a cannon yet?
No, fortunately not.
You've been so helpful with that book, I was wondering.
Can you help me with something else as well?
Of course, anything to help a fellow dwarf.
Dondakan wants to modify his multicannon, you see.
To fire a human.
A human, you say? Are we using humans as cannon fodder?
Well, good for him, never did like humans anyway.
But can you help me with the schematics?
Dondakan needs to know what he needs to modify.
Oh, I see, I see. No, I have no schematics.
All I have are the base schematics of the cannon.
I was on the multicannon project once, you know?
Oh, those will be a tremendous help already.
Can I borrow those off of you as well?
Well, of course, I have the schematics written on paper.
Let me just look for it.
Oh dear, I seem to have lost the schematics.
You are rather a forgetful person, aren't you?
I hardly ever lose anything, I'll have you know!
Now, you wouldn't be able to go look for the schematics?
Oh, alright, I'll go and have a look.
Say, you wouldn't happen to have another copy of book?
Don't tell me you lost that book!
Er, yes, I lost your book...
Lucky that I have another copy, isn't it?
Please don't lose it again.
Great, thanks a lot!
I can't seem to find your schematics...
Did you lose them down in the mines again?
Oh, let's see... well... maybe. I'm not altogether sure.
No idea at all?
Sorry, no... I do not even remember what I drew.
I found your schematics! You wrote them on that book!
Oh, of course, why didn't I think of that!
Do you have any schematics related to the dwarven multicannon?
Why, what do you need them for?
Ah, so you do!
Dondakan needs schematics to modify his multicannon.
To fire a human you see.
And you'd be the test subject? I mean, the cannonball?
Ehm, yes, I suppose so...
Haha, that I would like to see!
Here, take this. Khorvak sent it to me from White Wolf.
Kind of as a joke. It's incomplete, of course.
Doesn't mean anything without other parts.
Haha, he's always a laugh, that Khorvak.
Thanks... I suppose.
Do you have any schematics related to the dwarven multicannon?
Yes, and I already gave a part to you, remember?
Oh yes.
I think I have all the different parts of the schematics...
Let me have a look at that!
This doesn't make any sense, it's all jumbled up!
Sort it out, will you, don't torment an old dwarf.
I have that golden helmet you said I'd need.
What else did you need again?
I still need those schematics to modify my cannon.
It doesn't normally fire humans, you know.
I've got your schematics... what else was I supposed to do?
You'll need a golden helmet as well.
If you want to survive the blast.
I would prefer that, yes.
I've got your schematics all assembled.
And I have that golden helmet as well!
Well, go ahead and wear your helmet!
Won't protect your head if it's not on your head!
Wonderful! These schematics look simple enough...
Are you ready for your quick trip through the rock?
You may fire when ready!
Ah, such enthusiasm! Okay, here we go.
Let me have a look at those schematics.
Right, sitting comfortably?
Er, not really, no...
Excellent, excellent, I'll get the cannon ready.
I'm starting to get second thoughts about this!
Just think of all that gold!
I'm thinking of that demon...
Don't worry, it'll all be over in a moment!
That's what I'm afraid of.
Where... where am I?
What is this place?
Dondakan said there was supposed to be a river.
But I don't see a river here.
I think... I think... I think I may be...
...inside the rock!
You are in my domain now!
Begone lest you wish to be destroyed!
What? What was that?
Ow, my poor head... this helmet seems heavier than ever!
Ready as I'll ever be...
Okay, here we go, hold on to your helmet!
You did not heed my messages to stay away!
You have brought doom down on to yourself!
There are many aspects to my being.
There are many skills I possess.
You, I can see, are a skilled warrior.
Yet your might is no match for my magic!
You are an able ranger.
Yet that is useless against my might!
Your magical abilities are impressive.
But my powers of archery will foil them!
Behold, as my avatar descends to your level.
To extinguish the flame of your puny existence!
I am invincible! You stand no chance against me!
You are no match for me!
And while your power is great, mortal.
I will still resist you!
Your puny efforts cannot harm me!
Give up and resign yourself to your death!
Your puny efforts cannot harm me!
Give up and resign yourself to your death!
Your puny efforts cannot harm me!
Give up and resign yourself to your death!
The whole cave was shaking! What happened in there?
I em... let me just collect my thoughts.
It all seems like a sort of distant dream now.
I think I killed the Arzinian demon thing.
What, you actually killed him?
Well, I killed its avatar.
I'm not sure what happened to the demon itself.
Probably banished it to some hellish realm or other.
He'll be back, but not for a few thousand years.
But in the mean time, there's plenty of gold for me!
For us.
Of course, of course!
Whenever you want to go back in there, let me know...
Just don't forget to bring your helmet!
And here, have this rune pickaxe as well.
I can just use a normal one now anyway.
Great, thanks a lot!
No no, thank you!
After all these years, the riddle of the rock has been opened!
How are you doing, Dondakan?
Oh, just fine, just fine!
This gold is certainly creating a steady flow of income.
Can you shoot me into the rock again?
You need to wear that golden helmet...
Unless you want to crack open your skull on the rock.
Of course, just a second.
Let me adjust my cannon again.
Say, are you selling those boots of yours?
What, you mean these granite boots?
Yes, I'd be happy to pay quite some money for them!
Haha, I bet you would, I bet you would!
But I no longer need the money.
This rock is generating plenty!
Besides, I'm rather fond of them now...
Best boots I ever had!
Oh please...
No, I won't sell them.
Pretty please?
No!
Oh come on!!!
Well...
Yes?
How much gold would you be willing to pay for it?
Not that I'm selling my boots, mind.
I'm just curious.
What, are you trying to scam old Dondakan?
You want me to sell these boots for a measly amount?
I'm not selling them anyway.
You're so poor, you don't even have that much gold.
If I were selling my granite boots.
Which I'm clearly not.
I would certainly not accept mere coins for them.
That's quite a sum of money.
Which I notice you don't even have on you.
Haha, nice try!
Pity I'm not selling my boots.
Not for any price or any item.
I just wanted to see how high you would go!
Bah, thanks a lot.
Hey, that's quite a bit of money.
Which you don't have on you. Oh well.
I wasn't selling my boots anyway.
Never mind, I don't want them anymore.
Great, because I don't want to sell them.
Okay.
Right.
Check these out.
Where'd you get those from? Did you make your own?
Not quite, they were retrieved from the corpse of a wyvern.
You killed a wyvern? Last I heard they were all dead.
I never said I killed it!
But perhaps I did.
I am a grand adventurer after all!
Oh dear, oh dear.
It seems firing you head first into a rock was perhaps not best.
You've gone absolutely loony.
Hmm, well you do have a point...
It's alright Laddie, I'm just joking.
That's great, but I have to go now.
Come back any time!
Welcome to the Keldagrim library, human traveller!
What do you know about impenetrable rocks?
You're confusing me, what rock exactly are you talking about?
The big one in the mines south of the city.
Dondakan's big rock.
I see, I see.
I heard there was a demon inside there that you banished.
Yes, what exactly does that mean anyway?
There are some demons that we cannot see properly as mortals.
They also cannot be fought with normal weapons.
But sometimes these creatures manifest themselves in solid form.
Their avatar.
When you defeat an avatar, you defeat the actual demon.
But they don't die.
They are banished to where they came from originally.
Does that mean I will have to deal with this demon again?
Doubtful. He will grow stronger and stronger over time.
But that's a process that will take a thousand years at least.
Even dwarves don't live so long.
No, we won't see him again.
The mines are safe to dig for gold now.
Of course, that might lead to other problems eventually...

characters.name: Arzinian Avatar of Magic
characters.description: Deep, otherworldly demonic voice with echoing resonance. A magical manifestation of the Arzinian Being, arrogant and contemptuous of mortals, speaking with ancient malevolence.

characters.name: Arzinian Avatar of Ranging
characters.description: Deep, otherworldly demonic voice with echoing resonance. A ranged combat manifestation of the Arzinian Being, arrogant and contemptuous of mortals, speaking with ancient malevolence.

characters.name: Arzinian Avatar of Strength
characters.description: Deep, otherworldly demonic voice with echoing resonance. A physical manifestation of the Arzinian Being, arrogant and contemptuous of mortals, speaking with ancient malevolence.

characters.name: Arzinian Being of Bordanzan
characters.description: Booming, ethereal demonic voice with otherworldly reverb. An ancient extradimensional demon imprisoned in gold for a thousand years, speaking with terrifying authority and contempt for mortal intruders.

characters.name: Dondakan the Dwarf
characters.description: Elderly male dwarf, Scottish accent, stubborn and obsessive personality with a gold-loving nature. Father of Commander Veldaban who spent 18 years trying to break an impenetrable rock, now excitable when discussing his discovery.

characters.name: Dwarven Engineer
characters.description: Adult male dwarf, Scottish accent, practical and good-humored. Works at Wemund's Wrench Warehouse in Keldagrim, enjoys a good laugh and has connections throughout the dwarven engineering community.

characters.name: Khorvak, a dwarven engineer
characters.description: Adult male dwarf, slurred Scottish accent due to heavy drinking, friendly but unsteady. An intoxicated engineer found beneath White Wolf Mountain who has trouble standing, speaks with a lisp substituting 'sh' for 's' sounds.

characters.name: Librarian
characters.description: Middle-aged male dwarf, Scottish accent, scholarly and patient tone. The knowledgeable keeper of the Keldagrim library who welcomes visitors warmly and provides thoughtful explanations about dwarven lore and demons.

characters.name: Rolad
characters.description: Elderly male dwarf scholar, Scottish accent, absent-minded and forgetful but well-meaning. A former member of Dondakan's mining team and the multicannon project, now stationed with the Black Guard at Ice Mountain, constantly losing important documents.
